overview: The working of the brain and nervous system is an important frontier of modern medicine and nerves are the target for many important drugs. This subject will address how drugs modulate the processes of neuronal communication and survival in the context of the management of mood and emotional disorders, addictive behaviours, neuro-degenerative diseases, pain and epilepsy. This subject will also discuss strategies for the development of future therapeutics. Students will gain an appreciation of how a detailed understanding of pathophysiological processes is important for the rational development of new therapeutics.
ilo: Demonstrate a solid understanding of the nature of, and drug treatments for, a range of central nervous system diseases
Discuss the nature of research into central nervous system disorders and of the therapeutic and the undesirable actions of key therapeutic and recreational drugs
Outline, using examples, how knowledge of pathophysiological processes is important for rational drug development
Integrate key pharmacological and other medical research principles as they relate to neuropharmacology
Critically examine, synthesise and evaluate knowledge pertaining to drugs
generic_skills: Be adept at critical thinking and problem solving
Be adept at learning in a range of ways
